original_solution_mapping.L2: He is going to spend 25% of his time reading because 100 - 75 = <<100-75=25>>25
original_solution_mapping.L3: He has 4 hours to read because 16 x .25 = <<16*.25=4>>4
original_solution_mapping.L4: He will read 240 pages because 4 x 60 = <<4*60=240>>240

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6589.
    Returns: the number of books Billy reads.
    """
    # L1
    num_weekend_days = 2 # WK
    hours_per_day_weekend = 8 # 8 hours of free time on each day of the weekend
    total_free_hours_weekend = num_weekend_days * hours_per_day_weekend

    # L2
    total_percent = 100 # WK
    videogame_percent = 75 # 75% of his time playing video games
    reading_percent = total_percent - videogame_percent

    # L3
    reading_percent_decimal = 0.25 # the rest of his time reading (25%)
    reading_hours = total_free_hours_weekend * reading_percent_decimal

    # L4
    pages_per_hour = 60 # 60 pages an hour
    total_pages_read = reading_hours * pages_per_hour

    # L5
    pages_per_book = 80 # his books all contain 80 pages
    num_books_read = total_pages_read / pages_per_book

    # FA
    answer = num_books_read
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He is going to spend {reading_percent}% of his time reading because {total_percent} - {videogame_percent} = <<{total_percent}-{videogame_percent}={reading_percent}>>{reading_percent}
He has {reading_hours} hours to read because {total_free_hours_weekend} x {reading_percent_decimal} = <<{total_free_hours_weekend}*{reading_percent_decimal}={reading_hours}>>{reading_hours}
He will read {total_pages_read} pages because {reading_hours} x {pages_per_hour} = <<{reading_hours}*{pages_per_hour}={total_pages_read}>>{total_pages_read}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He has 1600 hours to read because 16 x 100 = <<16*100=1600>>1600
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He will read 96000 pages because 1600 x 60 = <<1600*60=96000>>96000

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_percent' (100) was used instead of 'reading_percent_decimal' (0.25).
